cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi NNE of Veracruz, Mexico and 310 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: continuing north-northwestward today, then slowing and turning north to north-northeast toward the south-central Texas coast Monday night/early Tuesday and then inland across the upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Texas coast near/just north of Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from north of Port Aransas to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from the Rio Grande through the upper Texas coast and into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39-46 mph, gusts 45-55 mph) possible Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday as Nicholas moves inland north of the port; cumulative 34-kt probability 22%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible along the upper Texas coast; Sabine Pass and Port Arthur could see water rises above 3 ft at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated totals up to 15 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential flash flooding of access roads, minor river rises in the Sabine/Neches system, and scattered power outages that could disrupt cargo handling and refinery operations.
